adjectives.description: catatonic (comparative more catatonic, superlative most catatonic)

entries.meaning: (medicine) Of, relating to, or suffering from catatonia; having a tendency to remain in a rigid state of stupor for long periods which give way to short periods of extreme agitation.
examples: However, he was looking a lot more catatonic and depressed before and sometimes we find that on the anti-depressants you remove the depression and uncover the paranoid stuff and we may have to give him larger quantities of tranquilizers just to tone this down.

entries.meaning: (figuratively) Motionless and unresponsive, as from shock; withdrawn.
(medicine) A patient in a state of catatonia.
examples: An inspection of Table IV shows that the catatonics have the lowest mean reversal score of all the groups.
